message.content:
cs.AI, cs.GT, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.RO 

The paper discusses the use of decision theoretic techniques to construct non-player characters that can assist a human player in collaborative games. This involves solving Markov decision processes and using intention recognition to infer the subtask that the human is currently performing. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.GT (Game Theory). Additionally, the paper focuses on human-computer interaction and collaboration, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The use of decision theoretic techniques and intention recognition also suggests that the paper could belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.RO (Robotics).
